title: limonata API
text:
set_nature_palette (palette_name:str)

Sets the colour palette to the specified nature palette. Run show_nature_palettes() to plot available palettes.

set_nature_palette("Spring")









 set_city_palette (palette_name:str)

Sets the colour palette to the specified city palette. Run show_city_palettes() to plot palettes.

set_city_palette("TuebingenClassic")

title: limonata API
text:
set_nature_palette (palette_name:str)

Sets the colour palette to the specified nature palette. Run show_nature_palettes() to plot available palettes.

title: limonata API
text:
Displaying Palettes


show_nature_palettes

 show_nature_palettes ()

Displays a bar chart of all available nature palettes

show_nature_palettes()

























show_city_palettes

 show_city_palettes ()

Displays a bar chart of all available nature palettes

show_city_palettes()
















show_all_palettes

 show_all_palettes ()

Display all available palettes from nature, and cities

show_all_palettes()

Nature palettes
City palettes

title: limonata
text:
How to use
You can currently set a “nature” or a “city” palette. These are palettes we created from pictures we took. Use the following functions to set a palette:

from limonata import set_city_palette
set_city_palette("TuebingenClassic")




Or you can see which palettes are available with the following functions:

from limonata import show_nature_palettes
show_nature_palettes()






















See the documentation here for more details and examples.
